intro: Brachystelma shrirangii, commonly known as the shrirang starling cactus, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, branching structure with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions as an ornamental plant.
